channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: The ABC radio presenter on her media consumption and guilty streaming pleasures.
item.title: Wendy Harmer reveals her 3:30am news habits

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The Panthers finally delivered the title – and their coach has opened up on the extent of injuries to his squad.
item.title: ‘I couldn’t bear thinking about losing’: Sleepless Cleary buries his grand final hoodoo

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: Some childcare centres are seeking legal advice on whether they can exclude children whose parents aren’t vaccinated against COVID-19.
item.title: Childcare sector examines how to protect workers and families from unvaccinated parents

item.description: Ms Berejiklian built a solid and deserved reputation when dealing with exceptional matters – bushfires, drought.
item.title: Pork-barrel shrug set the standard at a cynical low

item.dc:creator: Lyn Maccallum
item.description: 13 unlucky for Mr Fadden, letters reveal war secrets, and photographic work.
item.title: In the Herald: October 4, 1941

item.description: Fifty years ago, the Herald’s Lenore Nicklin checked in with members of Ku-ring-gai Voluntary Bush Fire Brigade, who had spent an exhausting few days fighting fires in Sydney’s north.
item.title: From the Archives, 1971: Long, long weekend amid flames

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Outgoing South Sydney coach Wayne Bennett says he has “a number of options on the table” to consider as he ponders his next move after the grand final defeat.
item.title: ‘I have a number of options’: Bennett coy on his next coaching role

item.description: Liverpool manager Juergen Klopp likened refusal to take the COVID-19 vaccine to drink-driving, saying such people endanger others.
item.title: Liverpool manager Klopp’s jab at the unvaccinated

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Penrith are the 2021 NRL premiers, beating South Sydney 14-12 in a thrilling grand final to win their first title since 2003.
item.title: NRL 2021 Grand Final as it happened: Crichton intercept snatches thrilling decider

item.dc:creator: Malcolm Conn
item.description: The teams shared two points each for the draw on Sunday night but Australia won the preceding three-match one-day series 2-1.
item.title: India dominate drawn Test but Australia lead multi-format series

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Penrith’s cult hero winger had not even collected his premiership ring before handing one to stunned girlfriend Moesha Crichton-Ropati at Suncorp Stadium.
item.title: To’o proposes to girlfriend after grand final win as power outage hits Souths fans

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Adam Reynolds produced so many magical moments with his boot for South Sydney, but a sideline conversion and long-range field-goal failed in the grand final.
item.title: This was not how the fairytale was meant to end for Adam Reynolds

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Nathan Cleary won the Clive Churchill Medal and embraced his father Ivan on stage in emotional scenes.
item.title: Father-son embrace for Clearys completes premiership fairytale

item.description: South Sydney Rabbitohs take on Penrith Panthers in the 2021 NRL Grand Final at Suncorp Stadium, Brisbane.
item.title: NRL Grand Final 2021 - Panthers v Rabbitohs

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today’s interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and Superquiz, Monday, October 4

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Penrith have prevailed over South Sydney 14-12 in this year’s NRL grand final. See who shone and who had a game to forget.
item.title: NRL grand final player ratings: how both sides fared in the biggest game of the year

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: On almost the same spot that Brett Kimmorley threw an intercept pass to gift Matt Bowen and Queensland a famous Origin victory in 2005, Cody Walker replicated the heartbreak.
item.title: On same blade of grass as famous Kimmorley intercept, Walker repeats history

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: Not even border closures, lockdowns and super-spreading events could stand in the way of the Panthers finally realising their destiny.
item.title: Rocks then diamonds: Panthers avenge last year’s loss to climb rugby league’s Everest

item.description: A look at the follies, foibles and joys of the human race through the eyes of cartoonist Michael Leunig. Buy prints from Michael Leunig at https://www.thestore.com.au/category/artists/michael-leunig. Join us on Facebook at the Michael Leunig Appreciation Page.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Michael Leunig

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, October 4, 2021

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Stephen Crichton produced the definitive play for Penrith as they made amends for last year to beat Souths 14-12 in a brilliant grand final at Suncorp Stadium.
item.title: Crichton the hero as Panthers beat Souths in wondrous NRL grand final

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, October 3, 2021

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: NSW could have a new Premier with Dominic Perrottet tipped to take the job after the shock resignation of Gladys Berejiklian on Friday.
item.title: As it happened Australia news: Perrottet tipped to become NSW Premier; Victoria records 1220 new COVID-19 cases; NSW reports 667 local infections

item.description: Time disappears when you’re in a spin.
item.title: A quick-drying case of caveat emptor

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Dominic Perrottet is expected to announce his intention to run for the Liberal leadership.
item.title: Deal struck for Dominic Perrottet to become premier, Stuart Ayres his deputy

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: It was an unexpected moment of raw emotion during Sunday’s coronavirus press conference, encapsulating the tragedy of the pandemic better than any politician ever could.
item.title: Holding hands with the dying: Nurses bring home horrors of COVID-19

item.description: Voters have backed a radical proposal to nationalise big landlords, in a bid to bring rents under control.
item.title: As house prices soar, Berliners are angry. And so is much of Europe

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: In an anonymous building on the edge of the Melbourne CBD, one of the state’s most powerful law enforcement agencies runs a court-like office extracting information from Melbourne’s underworld.
item.title: Where hard men are broken: Inside the Victorian legal system’s ‘secret place’

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: Of the 1220 coronavirus cases reported on Sunday, 236 were in the south-east, which now also holds the state’s highest effective reproduction number.
item.title: Fears grow about rising COVID-19 infections in Melbourne’s south-east

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: “If there is any community spread ... [a lockdown] could happen,” the Premier said on Sunday as Queensland’s tally hit four local COVID cases over the past three days.
item.title: Lockdown ‘could happen’ still, as Qld hospitals prepare for case surge

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Staff and students return to classrooms for Term 4 on Tuesday, with mask rules firmly in place.
item.title: No lockdown, no remote learning – but masks still a must for Qld schools

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: Premier Daniel Andrews says further details of the mandatory vaccination scheme allowing entry to a range of hospitality venues and businesses will be announced in coming weeks.
item.title: QR code check-ins central to ‘vaccinated economy’ plan as regional trials loom

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: NSW Transport Minister Andrew Constance has quit State Parliament for a tilt at federal politics but is distancing himself from the support of Prime Minister Scott Morrison.
item.title: ‘I’m independent’: Constance quits NSW Parliament in bid for federal seat

item.dc:creator: Malcolm Conn
item.description: Women’s Test cricket is a rare and clearly underfunded format, so greater investment by administrators is urgently needed for players to thrive.
item.title: Given the slip: No spikes nor DRS expose gulf for women despite Starc’s kindness

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: James Kennedy will decide on which sprinter will be in his slot in $15 million showcase in the next 48 hours.
item.title: Kennedy needs quick back-up for Everest after Rothfire withdrawn

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Ciaron Maher and David Eustace hope their stayer can follow in the footsteps of Almandin to Melbourne Cup, while they try to saddle as many as four in the Caulfield Cup.
item.title: Grand Promenade on proven course for Melbourne Cup

item.dc:creator: Michael Yabsley
item.description: ‘Yes’, the electorate nodded in October last year, ‘we’ve all had a Daryl’. One award-winning performance from the Gladys’Berejiklian will be used in media training circles for decades to come.
item.title: ‘Poor Gladys’ Berejiklian passed the pub test but the ICAC is another matter

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: QPS confirmed on Sunday that Senior Constable Neil Glen Punchard had resigned, following the successful appeal against his sentence for computer hacking.
item.title: Qld cop who leaked DV victim’s details quits after three-year court battle

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Never Been Kissed will attempt to emulate Montefilia by completing the Flight Stakes and Spring Champion Stakes double at Randwick on Saturday.
item.title: Flight winner Never Been Kissed to step up in the Spring Champion

item.description: Everything you need to know to find a winner at the public holiday meeting.
item.title: Race-by-race preview and tips for Warwick Farm on Monday

item.description: Heza Gentleman recorded back-to-back wins in August in the Dubbo Cup Prelude and a Benchmark 72 race at Kensington and has been freshened up since his last start eighth in the Dubbo Cup.
item.title: Kearney lines up Heza Gentleman four slot in Four Pillars

item.dc:creator: Nicole Precel
item.description: Some migrant women on temporary visas are experiencing servitude and physical and sexual abuse, and the need for specialised services to support them continue to rise.
item.title: Slavery in our suburbs: The matrix of marriage, migration and abuse

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Samu Kerevi’s ankle injury isn’t as bad as first thought. Meanwhile, the RA chairman says the Wallabies coach is “everything that we could have hoped for”.
item.title: Kerevi’s season not over yet, McLennan lauds ‘incredible’ Rennie

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Top Sydney trainer David Payne anxiously awaiting Caulfield Cup penalty for his mare Montefilia after she took out the Metropolitan as rivals queue for Incentivise.
item.title: Payne waits on Caulfield Cup penalty as rivals jostle to face Incentivise

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Just two years ago, Ofahiki Ogden spoke about his desire to join the police force. Now he’s been charged with drug possession.
item.title: Bulldogs forward who wanted to be a cop charged with drug possession

item.description: Facebook has been accused of making mistakes following the failed election bid of Donald Trump, which ultimately led it to be used in the storming of the US Capitol.
item.title: Whistleblower accuses Facebook of measures that led to Capitol riots

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: Fully vaccinated Australians have the chance to win a $1 million prize in a lottery set up by a group of companies and philanthropists who hope to drive up COVID-19 jab rates.
item.title: A million reasons to get jabbed: New lottery offers prizes for vaccinated people

item.dc:creator: Briony Scott
item.description: Over the past 18 months, schools have followed multiple messages from multiple stakeholders, often conflicting and sometimes downright absurd.
item.title: When this pandemic is over, schools need a louder voice at table

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: All the latest drama and insight ahead of the NRL grand final, including Russell Crowe’s $200,000 insurance policy and what the NRL has planned for the 2022 season draw.
item.title: Reynolds’ Broncos in line to square off against Rabbitohs in 2022 season opener

item.dc:creator: Madeleine Heffernan
item.description: Melbourne’s schools will welcome year 12 students back to classrooms this week in the first step of a staggered return to on-site learning, as COVID-19 cases are expected to rise during term four.
item.title: Schools begin the slow return to on-site learning
